process.name: Utility - File Management Tests
process.narrative: A suite of tests for the "Utility - File Management" VBO. See bug 7471

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

exception.detail: "Error when creating directory: " & [Message]
"Directory should already exist; CreateDir action should fail, but it did not"

stage.name: Create Test Dir (Don't Error If Exists)

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

exception.detail: "Directory exists, but action told not to error - it still errored: " & [Message]

input.name: Raise exception on any failure
input.narrative: Flag indicating if failure should cause an exception to be raised rather than a return of a success output value

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

exception.detail: "Directory should already exist; CreateDir action should fail with an exception, but it did not raise one - Success: " & [Success] & "; Message: " & [Message]

input.name: Raise exception on any failure
input.narrative: Flag indicating if failure should cause an exception to be raised rather than a return of a success output value

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative: Should fail again, but without an exception this time

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative: Should fail by throwing an exception

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to check for sub directories

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if the check was successful

input.name: Raise exception on any failure
input.narrative: Flag indicating if failure should cause an exception to be raised rather than a return of a success output value

exception.detail: "Subdirectory in root folder (" & [Test Root Dir] & ") doesn't exist - it should"

stage.name: Combine / Split Path
stage.narrative: Tests the combining and splitting of path elements, and creates a test folder deep(ish) inside the test root folder

input.name: Folder
input.narrative: The folder to combine

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The file to combine

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path in which to create the directory

input.name: Error If Already Exists
input.narrative: True to generate an error if the directory already exists

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The path to split

input.name: Folder
input.narrative: The folder to combine

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The file to combine

exception.detail: "Paths don't match: Original '" & [Full Path] & "'; After round trip: " & [Second Full Path]

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The path to split

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

exception.detail: "Delete of root dir should have failed due to not being empty, but it worked"

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to check for sub directories

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if the check was successful

exception.detail: "Subdirectory in path (" & [Path] & ") doesn't exist - it should (specifically, the folder " & [Last Path Element] & " should exist)"

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to check for sub directories

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if the check was successful

exception.detail: "Subdirectory in path (" & [Path] & ") should not exist, but apparently it does"

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The path to split

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Directory path below root is: Further\Down\The\RabbitHole

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Directory path below root after this: Further\Down\The

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Directory path below root after this: Further

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The path to split

exception.detail: "Path should equal Root at this point. Path: '" & [Path] & "'; Root: '" & [Test Root Dir] & "'"

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Full path is long gone at this point

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

exception.detail: "Delete of full path should have failed due to it not existing, but it worked"

input.narrative: The folder to combine

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The file to combine

input.name: Directory Path

input.name: Error If Not Exists

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to check for sub directories

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if the check was successful

exception.detail: "Root directory should have no subdirectories left, but apparently it still does"

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The path to split

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Removes 'Down\The' - leaves path at '$Root\Further'

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative: Removes Further' - leaves path at '$Root'

input.name: Directory Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to delete

input.name: Error If Not Exists
input.narrative: Set True to raise an error if the path does not exist

input.name: Recursive
input.narrative: Set True to delete all sub-directories of the path aswell

input.name: Directory Name
input.narrative: The directory to check exists

exception.detail: "Directory (" & [Test Root Dir] & ") doesn't exist - it should"
"Error when deleting root directory: " & [Message]

exception.detail: "Failed to write to " & [Write Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path the file to read the text from

exception.detail: "Failed to read from " & [Write Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"
"Content for " & [Write Text File] & " didn't match. Expected: """ & [Magritte] & """, but found: """ & [Text Content] & """"

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path of the text file to append to

input.name: Text
input.narrative: The text to append to the file

stage.name: Chéret
stage.initialvalue: Yvette Guilbert au Concert Parisien Tous les Soirs a 10 heures

input.name: Text to Split
input.narrative: The text to split

output.name: Split Values
output.narrative: The resulting collection containing the split values

exception.detail: "Failed to append line: '" & [Chéret Lines.Value] & "' to " & [Append Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path to the file to write the text to

input.name: Text
input.narrative: The text to write to the file

exception.detail: "Failed to write to " & [Copy Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The full path to the file to move

input.name: Destination Path
input.narrative: The path to the folder to move the file to

exception.detail: "Failed to move " & [Copy Text File] & " to " & [Move Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The full path to the file to be copied

input.name: Destination Path
input.narrative: The path of the directory to copy the file to

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "The file: " & [Copy Text File] & "; still exists - it should have been moved to: " & [Move Text File]

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "The file: " & [Move Text File] & "; doesn't exist - it should have been moved from: " & [Copy Text File]
"Failed to copy " & [Move Text File] & " to " & [Copy Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "The file: " & [Move Text File] & "; doesn't exist - it should have remained after being copied to: " & [Copy Text File]

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "The file: " & [Copy Text File] & "; doesn't exist - it should have been copied from: " & [Move Text File]

stage.name: Rousseau
stage.initialvalue: Title, Year The Sleeping Gypsy, 1897 Tiger in a Tropical Storm, 1891 The Hungry Lion Throws Itself on the Antelope, 1905 The Snake Charmer, 1907 Boy on the Rocks, 1897 The Repast of the Lion, 1907 Flowers in a Vase, 1902 Woman Walking in an Exotic Forest, 1905 Scout Attacked by a Tiger, 1904 Combat of a Tiger and a Buffalo, 1909 "Self-Portrait of the Artist, with a Lamp", 1903 The Waterfall, 1910 Mauvaise surprise, 1901 The Muse Inspires the Poet, 1909 Dahlia and Daisies in a Vase, 1904 Portrait of a Woman, The Dream, 1910 Self-Portrait, 1890

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path to the file to write the text to

input.name: Text
input.narrative: The text to write to the file

exception.detail: "Failed to write to " & [CSV File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Write / Read

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Append / Read Lines

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Move

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Copy

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: CSV

input.name: CSV File Path
input.narrative: The full path to the CSV file

input.name: First Line Is Header
input.narrative: Set True if you want to treat the first line as a header

output.name: CSV Values
output.narrative: The collection populated with the values of the CSV file

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Well, wasn't that absent-minded of me?

exception.detail: "First line of CSV returned from " & [CSV File] & " did not match the expected header (ie. Column1=Title; Column2=Year)"

input.name: CSV File Path
input.narrative: The full path to the CSV file

input.name: First Line Is Header
input.narrative: Set True if you want to treat the first line as a header

output.name: CSV Values
output.narrative: The collection populated with the values of the CSV file

input.name: Text to Split
input.narrative: The text to split

output.name: Split Values
output.narrative: The resulting collection containing the split values

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Necessary to traverse two collections in parallel

decision.expression: [Rousseau Title] = [Rousseau Paintings.Title] AND ([Rousseau Year] = -1 OR [Rousseau Year] = [Rousseau Paintings.Year])

exception.detail: "Line of CSV returned from " & [CSV File] & " did not match the expected value; Expected: " & [Rousseau Title] & " in " & [Rousseau Year] & "; Found: " & [Rousseau Paintings.Title] & " in " & [Rousseau Paintings.Year]

input.name: Regex Pattern
input.narrative: The regex pattern to apply

input.name: Target String
input.narrative: The target string to which apply the pattern and extract values

input.name: Named Values
input.narrative: A collection of named values to extract from the target string

output.name: Named Values
output.narrative: Results of the named values extracted from the regex

exception.detail: "Unrecognised Named Value: '" & [Named Values.Name] & "' with value: '" & [Named Values.Value] & "'"
"Ran out of Text/split lines before running out of CSV file/read lines - current CSV title: " & [Rousseau Paintings.Title] & "; and year: " & [Rousseau Paintings.Year]

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path the file to read the text from

exception.detail: "Failed to read from " & [Append Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"
"Content for " & [Append Text File] & " didn't match. Expected: """ & [Chéret] & """, but found: """ & [Text Content] & """"
"No Rousseau Paintings found... that can't be good"

input.name: Raise exception on any failure
input.narrative: Flag indicating if failure should cause an exception to be raised rather than a return of a success output value

input.name: Folder
input.narrative: The folder to combine

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The file to combine

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to be modified

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Never called - we only want to remove the first row before processing

stage.name: Note4
stage.narrative: Never called - we should bail at the first element

exception.detail: "No lines found after splitting: " & [Rousseau]

stage.name: Note5
stage.narrative: A bit lazy - deals with the blank year by setting it to -1

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path of the file to write to

input.name: Binary Data
input.narrative: The data to write to the file

exception.detail: "Failed to write binary data to " & [Write Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The full path the file to read the text from

exception.detail: "Failed to read (after binary write) from " & [Write Text File] & "; Also, should have thrown an exception directly, but apparently did not"
"Content for " & [Write Text File] & " didn't match. Expected: """ & [Magritte] & """, but found: """ & [Text Content] & """"

input.name: File Path
input.narrative: The file to read

input.name: Start Line
input.narrative: The first line to read

input.name: End Line
input.narrative: The last line to read

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True is the read was successful

output.name: Message
output.narrative: The exception detail if the read was unsuccessful

output.name: Lines
output.narrative: The lines read - the collection contains a single text column 'Line'

output.name: End of File
output.narrative: True if the end of the file was reached before the 'End Line' was reached

exception.detail: "Wrong number of lines for " & [Append Text File] & ". Expected: 2, but found: " & [Line Count]

stage.name: One of the two correct lines?

exception.detail: "Retrieved line from " & [Append Text File] & " did not match expected; Found: " & [Lines.Line]
"After reading lines from " & [Append Text File] & ", EOF was set to True; Should be False."

input.narrative: The full path to the file to delete

stage.narrative: Let's go back west and clean up our mess
